executeDbSave

public static void executeDbSave(EventHandlerContext context,
                                 java.lang.String tableName,
                                 java.util.Map values)
Inserts new record or updates an existing record. If a record with specified PK values exists already - updates the record. If not, adds a new record. Caller has to supply PK values, or the table must be autonumbered. If update, exactly one record must be updated.

Parameters:
context - Workflow rule execution context.
tableName - Name of the database table to update.
values - Map of PK values, will be used for both WHERE and SET clauses.

executeDbSave

public static void executeDbSave(EventHandlerContext context,
                                 java.lang.String tableName,
                                 java.util.Map values,
                                 java.util.Map oldFieldValues,
                                 boolean newRecord)
Inserts new or updates existing record. The client passes the old (unchanged) field values, so that if the primary key values are changed by the user, we can still find and update the same record.

Parameters:
context -
tableName -
values -
oldFieldValues -
newRecord -

                                   java.lang.String tableName,
                                   java.util.Map aValues)
Performs database update operation using specified table and PK field values.

Parameters:
context - Workflow rule execution context.
tableName - Name of the database table to update.
aValues - Map of PK values.

executeDbSql

public static void executeDbSql(EventHandlerContext context,
                                java.lang.String sql,
                                boolean updatedRecordsRequired)
Executes specified SQL INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE query. Uses PreparedStatement. Can not execute statements that require Statement, for example CREATE TRIGGER.

Parameters:
context - Workflow rule execution context.
sql - SQL query to execute.
updatedRecordsRequired - If true, and no records were updated, an exception is thrown.

executeDbSql

public static void executeDbSql(EventHandlerContext context,
                                java.lang.String tableName,
                                java.lang.String sql,
                                boolean updatedRecordsRequired)
Executes specified SQL INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE query. Uses PreparedStatement. Can not execute statements that require Statement, for example CREATE TRIGGER.

Parameters:
context - Workflow rule execution context.
sql - SQL query to execute.
updatedRecordsRequired - If true, and no records were updated, an exception is thrown.

executeDbSqlNoParameters

public static void executeDbSqlNoParameters(EventHandlerContext context,
                                            java.lang.String sql,
                                            boolean updatedRecordsRequired)
Executes specified SQL INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE query. Uses Statement. Can execute statements that require Statement, for example CREATE TRIGGER.

Parameters:
context - Workflow rule execution context.
sql - SQL query to execute.
updatedRecordsRequired - If true, and no records were updated, an exception is thrown.

executeDbCommit

public static void executeDbCommit(EventHandlerContext context)
Commits previously executed insert/update/delete operations. Normally all operations are commited by the container after the workflow rule is executed. Use this explicit method to commit the INSERT with autonumbered ID.

Parameters:
context - Workflow rule execution context.

executeDbRollback

public static void executeDbRollback(EventHandlerContext context)
Rollbacks previously executed insert/update/delete operations. Normally all operations are rolled back by the container if the workflow rule throws an exception.

Parameters:
context - Workflow rule execution context.

retrieveDbRecords

public static java.util.List retrieveDbRecords(EventHandlerContext context,
                                               java.lang.String sql,
                                               java.util.List viewFields,
                                               java.util.Map keyFields,
                                               int recordLimit,
                                               javax.xml.rpc.holders.BooleanHolder hasMoreRecords,
                                               org.dom4j.Element xmlRecords)
Executes SQL query and returns a List of selected records. Each record is Map that contains properties matching the SELECT clause column list. Can format some or all of the returned field values using ARCHIBUS formatting.

Parameters:
context - Workflow rule execution context.
sql - SQL query to SELECT zero or more records.
viewFields - Map of view fields to be formatted.
keyFields - Map of key fields to be formatted. The map keys are names of the columns from the SELECT clause. Fields that are not included into the map are not formatted.
recordLimit - How many records can be retrieved.
hasMoreRecords - Set to true if the recordLimit has been reached, but there are more records to read.
Returns:
List.

                                             java.lang.String message,
                                             java.lang.Object[] args)

localizeMessage

public static java.lang.String localizeMessage(EventHandlerContext context,
                                               java.lang.String activityId,
                                               java.lang.String referencedBy,
                                               java.lang.String messageId,
                                               java.lang.String localeName)
Localizes specified message from the messages database table, using either the current user locale or specified locale.

Parameters:
context - Workflow rule execution content.
activityId - messages.activity_id
referencedBy - messages.reference_by
messageId - messages.message_id
localeName - Name of the user locale (i.e. "en_US"). If null or empty string, the current user locale is used.
Returns:
Localized and formatted text message. If localized message is not found, return English message. If localized and english not found, as a last resort, returns default message id.

prepareMessage

                                              java.lang.String activityId,
                                              java.lang.String referencedBy,
                                              java.lang.String messageId,
                                              java.lang.String localeName,
                                              java.lang.Object[] args)

Parameters:
context - Workflow rule execution content.
activityId - messages.activity_id
referencedBy - messages.reference_by
messageId - messages.message_id
localeName - Name of the user locale (i.e. "en_US"). If null or empty string, the current user locale is used.
args - Array of objects to be injected into formatted message.
Returns:
Localized and formatted text message.

sendEmail

public static void sendEmail(java.lang.String text,
                             java.lang.String from,
                             java.lang.String host,
                             java.lang.String port,
                             java.lang.String subject,
                             java.lang.String to,
                             java.util.ArrayList cc,
                             java.util.ArrayList bcc,
                             java.lang.String userId,
                             java.lang.String password,
                             java.util.ArrayList attachmentFileNames)
Sends an email message.

Parameters:
text - Message text to send.
from - "from" email address.
host - Mail server host address.
host - Mail server port.
subject - Message subject.
to - "to" email address.
userId - User ID of the SMTP mail server.
password - Password of the SMTP mail server.
cc - List of "cc" email addresses.
bcc - List of "bcc" email addresses.
attachmentFileNames - List of attachment file names.

Parameters:
text - Message text to send.
from - "from" email address.
host - Mail server host address.
host - Mail server port.
subject - Message subject.
to - "to" email address.
userId - User ID of the SMTP mail server.

contentType - Allows for changing content type to html.

                             java.lang.String contentType,
                             java.lang.String activityId)
Sends an email message, and optionally logs it to afm_notification_log.

Parameters:
text - Message text to send.
from - "from" email address.
host - Mail server host address.
host - Mail server port.
subject - Message subject.
to - "to" email address.
userId - User ID of the SMTP mail server.
password - Password of the SMTP mail server.
cc - List of "cc" email addresses.
bcc - List of "bcc" email addresses.
attachmentFileNames - List of attachment file names.
contentType - Allows for changing content type to html.
activityId - The current activity ID.

getActivityLicensesAvailable

@Deprecated
public static int getActivityLicensesAvailable()
Deprecated. 

Returns the number of AbCoreLevel4Activity licenses available. This method exists for compatibility with V.19.1. Do not use it in any new code.

getActivityLicensesInUse

@Deprecated
public static int getActivityLicensesInUse()
Deprecated. 

Returns the number of AbCoreLevel4Activity licenses in use. This method exists for compatibility with V.19.1. Do not use it in any new code.

Deprecated. 

Find its corresponding translatable name by a normal field name (e.g. for afm_ptasks.task this would return task_fr, task_de, etc. depending on the current user's locale) If you use the datasource API rather than SQL statements, the datasource API handles these mappings automatically and you do not need to use this method. As such, use of this method is discouraged.)

Parameters:
context - Workflow rule execution context.
tableName - Table name
fieldName - Field name

Returns:
A corresponding translatable field name as a String

checkAddInLicense

public static void checkAddInLicense(java.lang.String applicationName,
                                     java.lang.String applicationSecurityKey)
Checks that:

1. The customer name in the add-in license file is the same as "Licensed To" property in the stock ARCHIBUS license file.

2. The applicationSecurityKey matches the securityKey in the add-in license file.

Third-party applications call this license check at key places (the beginning of the public methods) in their workflow rules.

Parameters:
applicationName - Third-party application name, for example "MyARCHIBUSAddIn".
applicationSecurityKey - Security key of the application, for example "k1ndl33secure!my$add-in".
Throws:
com.archibus.utility.ExceptionBase - if the check fails.
